General.Name: Bulbasaur
General.Monster_Description: For some time after its birth, it grows by gaining nourishment from the seed on its back.

Type.Description: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
Inflicts regular damage.

General.Name: Ivysaur
General.Monster_Description: When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flowers coming bloom.

Type.Description:
Plants a seed on the target that drains 1/8 of its max HP at the end of every turn and heals the user for the amount taken.  Has no effect on grass Pokémon.  The seed remains until the target leaves the field.

The user takes damage instead of being healed if the target has liquid-ooze.

rapid-spin will remove this effect.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.
Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

General.Name: Venusaur
General.Monster_Description: After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.

Type.Description:
Plants a seed on the target that drains 1/8 of its max HP at the end of every turn and heals the user for the amount taken.  Has no effect on grass Pokémon.  The seed remains until the target leaves the field.

The user takes damage instead of being healed if the target has liquid-ooze.

rapid-spin will remove this effect.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.
Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

General.Name: Charmander
General.Monster_Description: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.

Type.Description: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.
Inflicts regular damage.

General.Name: Charmeleon
General.Monster_Description: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

Type.Description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.
Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

General.Name: Charizard
General.Monster_Description: It is said that Charizards fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

Type.Description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

General.Name: Squirtle
General.Monster_Description: It shelters itself in its shell then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.

Type.Description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.
Inflicts regular damage.

General.Name: Wartortle
General.Monster_Description: It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.

Type.Description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.
Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

General.Name: Blastoise
General.Monster_Description: The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.

Type.Description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

General.Name: Caterpie
General.Monster_Description: It releases a stench from its red antenna to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.

Type.Description: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
Inflicts regular damage.

General.Name: Metapod
General.Monster_Description: A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. It quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.

Type.Description: Raises the user's Defense by one stage.

Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca-berry or rowap-berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

General.Name: Butterfree
General.Monster_Description: It loves the honey of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.

Type.Description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.
Poisons the target.

General.Name: Weedle
General.Monster_Description: It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.

Type.Description: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

General.Name: Kakuna
General.Monster_Description: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

Type.Description: Raises the user's Defense by one stage.

Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca-berry or rowap-berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

General.Name: Beedrill
General.Monster_Description: Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.

Type.Description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

User's critical hit rate is two levels higher until it leaves the field.  If the user has already used focus-energy since entering the field, this move will fail.

This effect is passed on by baton-pass.

General.Name: Pidgey
General.Monster_Description: It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

Type.Description: Inflicts regular damage.

Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop, this move will hit with double power.

General.Name: Pidgeotto
General.Monster_Description: It flies over its wide territory in search of prey, downing it with its highly developed claws.

Type.Description: Inflicts regular damage.
Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

General.Name: Rattata
General.Monster_Description: It searches for food all day. It gnaws on hard objects to wear down its fangs, which grow constantly during its lifetime.

General.Name: Raticate
General.Monster_Description: With its long fangs, this surprisingly violent Pokémon can gnaw away even thick concrete with ease.

Type.Description: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.
Inflicts regular damage.

General.Name: Spearow
General.Monster_Description: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.

Type.Description: Inflicts regular damage.
Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

General.Name: Fearow
General.Monster_Description: It has the stamina to fly all day on its broad wings. It fights by using its sharp beak.

Type.Description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca-berry or rowap-berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.
Inflicts regular damage.

General.Name: Ekans
General.Monster_Description: It sneaks through grass without making a sound and strikes unsuspecting prey from behind.

Type.Description: Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

rapid-spin cancels this effect.

General.Name: Arbok
General.Monster_Description: The pattern on its belly is for intimidation. It constricts foes while they are frozen in fear.

Type.Description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target and a separate 10% chance to make the target flinch.

General.Name: Pikachu
General.Monster_Description: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

Type.Description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

General.Name: Raichu
General.Monster_Description: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

Lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

General.Name: Sandshrew
General.Monster_Description: It digs deep burrows to live in. When in danger, it rolls up its body to withstand attacks.

General.Name: Sandslash
